SENTIENT SPECIES:
Orange Catoids: Always curious and often cruel. They have orange skin. They have bilateral symmetry. They are hyperactive and have a complex system of social rules. They first evolved on Krantor II in 2010.
	Their Stats are: STR: 1 DEX: 1 CON: 1 INT: -1 CHA: 2
Scaly Orange Robots with Long Tails: Purely mechanical lifeforms, artificially created. They have orange scales. They have bilateral symmetry. They use their long tails for balance. They are modest and have a deep need to conform. They were created by the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots on Tabernak V as servants in 2669.
	Their Stats are: STR: 0 DEX: 0 CON: 1 INT: 2 CHA: -1
Immortal Robots with Threefold Symmetry: Purely mechanical lifeforms, artificially created. They have trilateral symmetry. They have no fixed lifespan and only die of disease or accidents. They are reclusive and deeply rationalist. They were created by the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots on Ayloq I as servants in 2645.
	Their Stats are: STR: 2 DEX: 1 CON: -1 INT: 2 CHA: 3
Two-Headed Blue Robots: Purely mechanical lifeforms, artificially created. They have blue skin. They have two heads that tend to constantly bicker with one another. They have bilateral symmetry. They are fond of practical jokes and always willing to listen. They were created by the Twelfth Republic of Catoids and Robots on Gylow IV as servants in 2687.
	Their Stats are: STR: -2 DEX: 0 CON: 2 INT: 0 CHA: 0
Amorphous Robots with Giant Eyes: Purely mechanical lifeforms, artificially created. They have bilateral symmetry and are able to greatly alter their shape. Their giant eyes take up most of their head. They are reclusive and have a deep need to conform. They were created by the Third Church of Feathered White Robots on Freia V as servants in 2599.
	Their Stats are: STR: 0 DEX: 1 CON: 2 INT: 0 CHA: 0
Feathered White Robots: Purely mechanical lifeforms, artificially created. They have white feathers. They have bilateral symmetry. They are humorless and unwilling to compromise. They were created by the Second Church of Orange Catoids on Sativex VI as servants in 2148.
	Their Stats are: STR: -1 DEX: 3 CON: 0 INT: 1 CHA: 1

CIVILISATIONS:
THE TWELFTH REPUBLIC OF CATOIDS AND ROBOTS:
An ancient, corrupt, fantastically wealthy, highly advanced Republic of 23 planets, with 47 billion inhabitants.
Major populations:
15 billion Orange Catoids.
5 billion Two-Headed Blue Robots.
5 billion Amorphous Robots with Giant Eyes.
6 billion Feathered White Robots.
7 billion enslaved Scaly Orange Robots with Long Tails.
9 billion enslaved Immortal Robots with Threefold Symmetry.
It controls a Teleport Gate.
It controls a Planet Destroyer.
It controls a Universal Nutrient.
It controls a Living Weapon.
It controls a Youth Serum.

	Their Stats are: STR: -2 DEX: -3 CON: 0 INT: 0 CHA: 0
PLANETS:
GYKOP I
A barren planet of the Twelfth Republic of Catoids and Robots.
A mining base, built by the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2713
Deep Impenetrable Seas: Hundreds of kilometres down, water turns into ice from pressure.
Strata:
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2661, destroyed in 2712 during the invasion of the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots.
A Planet Destroyer created by the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2646, buried in 2660.
Remnants of a culture of Tiny Orange Robots that collapsed due to a shift in the planet's orbital axis in 2643.
Remnants of a culture of Orange Catoids that collapsed due to a shift in the planet's orbital axis in 2643.
Remnants of a culture of Feathered White Robots that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2571.
Remnants of a culture of Feathered White Robots that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2516.
Remnants of a culture of Orange Catoids that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2509.
Remnants of a culture of Orange Catoids that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2467.
Remnants of a culture of Feathered White Robots that collapsed due to orbital bombardment by the Third Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2449.
The ruins of a science lab, built by the Second Church of Giant Robots in 2062, destroyed in 2154 due to orbital bombardment by the Church of Orange Catoids.
Remnants of a culture of Blue Trolloids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 1708.
Remnants of a culture of Two-Headed Red Robots that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 747.

XARLAN III
A barren planet of the Twelfth Republic of Catoids and Robots.
It is slightly polluted.
A military base, built by the Third Church of Catoids and Robots in 2443
Vast Empty Plains: Brown, dusty and featureless, their monotony is broken only by the occasional rivulet around which cluster many flying animals.

HYLUS II
A life-bearing planet.
It is very heavily polluted.
Musical Caves: The wind whistles through massive caves and across rocks, producing an eerie music.
Strata:
Remnants of a culture of Orange Catoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2735.

Fossils of pharmaceuticals that went extinct in 2626 due to a shift in the planet's orbital axis.

Remnants of a culture of Orange Catoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2127.

The shattered wrecks of 2 spaceships of the fleet of Captain Frix Johnson, destroyed by a giant spaceborne purple crystal.
Fossils of radiovores that went extinct in 1103.

MYCON III
A barren planet of the Twelfth Republic of Catoids and Robots.
A mining base, built by the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2663
Gigantic Cave Network: Thousands of kilometres of partially submerged caves riddle the crust of this planet. Very easy to get lost or hide in.
Strata:
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Third Church of Catoids and Robots in 2419, destroyed in 2663 due to orbital bombardment by the Third Church of Feathered White Robots.
A block of time ice, encasing Unit 039, Autarch of the Fourth Church of Catoids and Robots created by the rogue AI Simulation 332 in 2530, hidden in 2534.
The ruins of a city of spires, built by the Third Church of Catoids and Robots in 2377, destroyed in 2405 by a shift in the planet's orbital axis.
A block of time ice, encasing Mrworr, Emperor of the Empire of Orange Catoids created by the rogue AI System 17 in 2271, lost and buried when the Republic of Catoids and Robots transcended in 2357.
The ruins of a vast underground vault, built by the Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2356, destroyed in 2357 after the transcendence of the Republic of Catoids and Robots.
Remnants of a culture of Immortal Yellow Robots that transcended the bounds of this universe in 2357.
Remnants of a culture of Orange Catoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2342.

LUMEN I
A life-bearing planet of the Twelfth Republic of Catoids and Robots.
It is a little polluted.
It is populated by:
3 billion Orange Catoids
5 billion enslaved Immortal Robots with Threefold Symmetry
A mining base, built by the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2675
A film about the Grand Matron of the Second Church of Four-Armed Orange Robots created by the Empire of Slim Robots in 1338
Periodical Darkness: Every thirteen years, the orbit of this planet synchronizes with that of a planet closer to its stars, causing a night that lasts for weeks.
Deep Impenetrable Seas: Hundreds of kilometres down, water turns into ice from pressure.
Strata:
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Fifth Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2493, destroyed in 2674 during the invasion of the Third Church of Feathered White Robots.
A Master Computer created by the rogue AI System 17 in 2274, lost and buried when the Republic of Catoids and Robots transcended in 2357.
A Time Machine created by the rogue AI Experiment 186 in 1832, hidden in 2291.
The ruins of a grand palace, built by the Second Church of Giant Robots in 2103, destroyed in 2185 when the planet was scoured by a superweapon of the Second Church of Orange Catoids.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2094.
Remnants of a culture of Blue Trolloids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2087.
Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Robots that collapsed due to orbital bombardment by the pirate Bluerock in 2068.
Remnants of a culture of Orange Catoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2066.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Grey Antoids that collapsed due to a massive asteroid impact in 875.

Poison World: Mineral deposits produce a steady stream of toxins that makes survival extremely difficult.
Titanic Mountains: Mountain ranges so vast they poke out of the atmosphere into space.

BEMUP II
A barren planet of the Twelfth Republic of Catoids and Robots.
It is somewhat polluted.
A mining base, built by the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2678
Vast Canyons: Gashes in the planet's crust so deep they reach the hot mantle, emitting gases noxious to much life but highly nutritious to some.
Musical Caves: The wind whistles through massive caves and across rocks, producing an eerie music.
Strata:

HISTORY:
0:
IN THE BEGINNING, ALL WAS DARK.
THEN, PLANETS BEGAN TO FORM:
Gykop I, Xarlan III, Hylus II, Mycon III, Gylow IV, Lumen I, Ayloq I, Erebus I, Freia V, Eelut I, Cykov IV, Sativex VI, Tabernak V, Mycon III, Cymos V, Bemup II, Eukip I, Taranis I, Chroma I, Krantor II, Goler II, Genur III, Sativex VI, Cenut VI

Life arises on Bemup II

Beautiful aurorae play across the skies of Cenut VI.

Sentient Orange Dwarfoids with Long Tails arise on Hylus II.

Sentient Two-Headed Humanoids arise on Bemup II.

74:
The Orange Dwarfoids with Long Tails on Hylus II achieve spaceflight and organise as a Military Dictatorship, the Empire of Orange Dwarfoids with Long Tails.

Civ Birth Year: 514

The population of Flying Koboldoids on Krantor II has grown by a billion.
Overcrowding on Hylus II leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Ayloq I leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Bemup II leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Eukip I leads to increased pollution.
The Second Empire of Slim Green Antoids colonise Mycon III. 
The Second Empire of Slim Green Antoids conquer Sativex VI, a colony of the Church of Catoids, Koboldoids and Robots.
The Second Empire of Slim Green Antoids gain control of the Universal Antidote on Sativex VI.
Overcrowding on Erebus I leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Krantor II leads to increased pollution.
The Church of Catoids, Koboldoids and Robots explore Gykop I. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Flying Koboldoids that collapsed through predation by ultravores in 621. They discover: The ruins of a complex of arcologies, built by the Church of Catoids, Koboldoids and Robots in 611, destroyed in 613 due to orbital bombardment by the pirate White Antenna. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Four-Armed Yellow Catoids that collapsed due to orbital bombardment by the pirate White Antenna in 613. 
The Church of Catoids, Koboldoids and Robots build a torture chamber on Erebus I.
The Church of Catoids, Koboldoids and Robots conquer Cykov IV, a colony of the Second Empire of Slim Green Antoids, using their mind control device to gain control of the planet from orbit.

Civ Name: Empire of Antoids and Robots

 Decomocratization Revival!Second Empire of Four-Armed Orange Robots previous decrepitude: 647 revival amount: 570

Civ Name: Second Empire of Four-Armed Orange Robots 
Civ Birth Year: 1266 
Civ Stats Str|Dex|Con|Int|Cha
          4 | 2 | 3 | 5 | 3 | 
Resources 496 Science 46 Military 109 WeapLevel 3 TechLevel 20 Decrepitude 324
A popular movement overthrows the old guard of the Second Empire of Four-Armed Orange Robots and declares the Eighth Republic of Antoids and Robots.
The rogue AI System 4 presents the inhabitants of Mycon III with a gift: a Virtual Reality Matrix.
The rogue AI Mind 469 steals the block of time ice, encasing Unit 039, Emperor of the Second Empire of Four-Armed Orange Robots on Genur III and hides it on Lumen I.

The Republic of Catoids, Koboldoids, Trolloids and Robots enters a dark age. Decrepitude set to 0,  was 116
Captain Unit 039 is sent on a mission to stop the rogue AI System 224 at Cymos V.
Captain Unit 039 manages to confuse the rogue AI System 224 with a clever logic puzzle, distracting it long enough to shut it down.

Captain Unit 039 manages to confuse the rogue AI System 397 with a clever logic puzzle, distracting it long enough to shut it down.

The Republic of Catoids and Robots enters a golden age of industry! The Republic of Catoids and Robots build a mining base on Taranis I. 
The Republic of Catoids and Robots conquer Eelut I, a colony of the Sixth Church of Orange Catoids, killing 3 billion in the process.
2353:
The population of Orange Catoids on Hylus II has grown by a billion.
The population of Orange Catoids on Freia V has grown by a billion.
The population of Orange Catoids on Cykov IV has grown by a billion.
Overcrowding on Freia V leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Cykov IV leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Chroma I leads to increased pollution.

The Sixth Church of Orange Catoids attack Eelut I, a colony of the Republic of Catoids and Robots, and subject it to orbital bombardment, killing 6 billion.
The Republic of Catoids and Robots conquer Sativex VI, a colony of the Sixth Church of Orange Catoids.

Overcrowding on Freia V leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Chroma I leads to increased pollution.

The Republic of Catoids and Robots conquer Genur III, a colony of the Sixth Church of Orange Catoids.
Captain Mmbrrow extorts money from Cymos V, a planet of the enemy Sixth Church of Orange Catoids.
The Republic of Catoids and Robots send Captain Mmbrrow on a mission to steal the Block of Time Ice on Cykov IV.
Captain Mmbrrow successfully acquires the Block of Time Ice and delivers it to Cenut VI.

The Republic of Catoids and Robots conquer Lumen I, a colony of the Sixth Church of Orange Catoids.
The Republic of Catoids and Robots send Captain Mmbrrow on a mission of peace to the Sixth Church of Orange Catoids.
The expert diplomacy of Captain Mmbrrow is successful: the two empires are at peace.

The Republic of Catoids and Robots explore Lumen I. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Immortal Red Trolloids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2070. 
An expedition led by Captain Mmbrrow explores Ayloq I. They trade with the local Orange Catoids. 
An expedition led by Captain Mmbrrow explores Eukip I. They recover: A Master Computer created by the rogue AI System 17 in 2274, buried in 2349. 
An expedition led by Captain Mrwow explores Gylow IV. They trade with the local Immortal Yellow Robots.

The Third Republic of Catoids and Robots experiences a population boom! 
The Third Republic of Catoids and Robots conquer Taranis I, a colony of the Kingdom of Catoids and Robots, using their mind control device to gain control of the planet from orbit.
Overcrowding on Sativex VI leads to increased pollution.
The Kingdom of Catoids and Robots send a delegation to Cymos V. They declare war on the Third Church of Catoids and Robots! 
The Kingdom of Catoids and Robots attack Eelut I, a colony of the Third Church of Catoids and Robots, and subject it to orbital bombardment, killing 2 billion.
The rogue AI Mind 239 reappears on Genur III.
Captain Meeoaw is sent on a mission to stop the rogue AI Mind 239 at Genur III.
Captain Meeoaw manages to confuse the rogue AI Mind 239 with a clever logic puzzle, distracting it long enough to shut it down.
The Third Republic of Catoids and Robots send Captain Meeoaw on a mission of peace to the Kingdom of Catoids and Robots.
Unfortunately, the peace mission fails. Captain Meeoaw hastily retreats to Ayloq I.

The population of Orange Catoids on Gykop I has grown by a billion.
The population of Tiny Purple Robots on Ayloq I has grown by a billion.
The population of Orange Catoids on Eelut I has grown by a billion.

The population of Orange Catoids on Cenut VI has grown by a billion.
Overcrowding on Hylus II leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Eelut I leads to increased pollution.
The Third Church of Catoids and Robots explore Erebus I. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Orange Catoids that collapsed due to a series of volcanic eruptions in 2317. 
A famine breaks out on Eelut I, killing 3 billion.
The Third Church of Catoids and Robots attack and raze Chroma I, a colony of the Kingdom of Catoids and Robots.
Overcrowding on Gykop I leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Ayloq I leads to increased pollution.
Overcrowding on Cenut VI leads to increased pollution.
The Third Republic of Catoids and Robots conquer Lumen I, a colony of the Kingdom of Catoids and Robots, using their mind control device to gain control of the planet from orbit.
Overcrowding on Sativex VI leads to increased pollution.
The Kingdom of Catoids and Robots explore Sativex VI. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Feathered White Robots that transcended the bounds of this universe in 2357. 
The Kingdom of Catoids and Robots terraform and colonise Gylow IV.
The Kingdom of Catoids and Robots conquer Hylus II, a colony of the Third Church of Catoids and Robots.
An expedition led by Captain Meeoaw explores Goler II. 
The Third Republic of Catoids and Robots send Captain Meeoaw on a mission of peace to the Kingdom of Catoids and Robots.
The expert diplomacy of Captain Meeoaw is successful: the two empires are at peace.

They discover: The ruins of a mining base, built by the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots in 2671, destroyed in 2711 when the planet was scoured by a superweapon of the Tenth Republic of Catoids and Robots. They discover: The ruins of a grand palace, built by the Third Church of Feathered White Robots in 2606, destroyed in 2670 by a series of volcanic eruptions. They recover: A film about the Grand Matron of the Second Church of Four-Armed Orange Robots created by the Empire of Slim Robots in 1338, buried in 2355. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed from mass hysteria in 1759.
